definition: to speak/to explain/to negotiate/to emphasise/to be particular about/as far as sth is concerned/speech/lecture

road/path/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3]/principle/truth/morality/reason/skill/method/Dao (of Daoism)/to say/to speak/to talk/classifier for long thin things (rivers, cracks etc), barriers (walls, doors etc), questions (in an exam etc), commands, courses in a meal, steps in a process/(old) circuit (administrative division)
present the facts and reason things out
pinyin: bai3 shi4 shi2 jiang3 dao4 li3

sentences.english: Reasoning does not seem to work with them.
sentences.chinese: 跟他们讲道理似乎不管用。

sentences.english: This is the glory of expository preaching, we were told.
sentences.chinese: 有人说，这是释经讲道的荣耀。

sentences.english: Even though you are fairily beautiful you need to be logical with others.
sentences.chinese: 即使你美若天仙，做什么事情还是要讲道理的。

sentences.english: Pray for Pastor Don Baron who was sick and felt dizzy on last Sunday while he was preaching.
sentences.chinese: 为柏大恩牧师祷告，上主日讲道时他感到身体不适。

sentences.english: A bully is not reasonable - he is persuaded only by threats.
sentences.chinese: 跟恶棍无法讲道理，恶棍只能以威吓劝说。

sentences.english: But he that prophesieth speaketh unto men to edification, and exhortation, and comfort.
sentences.chinese: 但作先知讲道的，是对人说，要造就，安慰，劝勉人。

sentences.english: Conviction of preacher passes into truth of hearers .
sentences.chinese: 讲道者的信念，使听者扎心知罪，认识真理。

sentences.english: We need to lay the facts bare, be reasonable and more so, the numbers to talk about.
sentences.chinese: 我们需要摆事实，讲道理，更需要数字来说话。

sentences.english: "Some were thrilled that Caesar had died, and some were horrified, " he said.
sentences.chinese: “对于凯撒的死，有人激动，有人惊悸，”他讲道。

sentences.english: My Dad scribbles a few words on a piece of paper, he calls it a sermon.
sentences.chinese: 我的父亲在一张纸上随便写，他称这是讲道。

sentences.english: China has long been one of the most strait-laced nations around.
sentences.chinese: 中国长久以来是世界各国里最讲道德礼貌的国家。

sentences.english: He blew the trumpet and used drum to let people hear him before he started preaching.
sentences.chinese: 在他开始讲道之前，他会吹喇叭并打鼓来让人听见。

sentences.english: Of course, when engaging in criticism we should present facts, reason things out and guard against being one-sided.
sentences.chinese: 当然，批判的时候要摆事实，讲道理，防止片面性。

sentences.english: He thought of his paper as a pulpit.
sentences.chinese: 他当初把这份报纸当做一个讲道坛。

sentences.english: Who teaches a sermon series on Habakkuk?
sentences.chinese: 谁会关于哈巴谷进行一系列的讲道？

sentences.english: Do not preach the Lord a sermon in your long prayers.
sentences.chinese: 切莫在你冗长的祷告中向主作一番讲道。

definition: to interrupt (sb talking)/to butt in/to cut into a conversation
paraphernalia of a guard of honor
to perform one's job/attendant/job/duties/(respectful appellation for the addressee) you/your Excellency/(Church) deacon
to talk to oneself/to think aloud/to soliloquize
human sympathy/humanitarianism/humane/the "human way", one of the stages in the cycle of reincarnation (Buddhism)/sexual intercourse
to curl one's lip/to twitch one's mouth
